regulatoryInteractions.note: Rob regulates acrAB operon expression in response to decanoate, but the specific mechanism remains to be investigated |CITS: [RDBECOLIPRC04288]|. The Rob induction complements the MarA and SoxS effects in this operon.

This regulatory interaction was identified by means of PhoPQ-related microarray experiments, and it was checked for the presence of the regulatory motif in the promoter region |CITS: [RDBECOLIPRC06813]|. A repressor function for acrAB operon transcription can be clearly anticipated from the localization of the PhoP-binding site, very close to the acrAp promoter core region.

The acrR gene, which is located upstream of and in the opposite direction of acrAB, encodes AcrR, a negative DNA-binding transcriptional regulator for a multidrug efflux pump. The presence of acrR upstream of the acrAB operon in E. coli suggests that the operon may be controlled at the level of transcription by this regulator |CITS [ 8821940]|.

Effects of sigmaS and the transcriptional activator AppY on induction of the Escherichia coli hya and cbdAB-appA operons in response to carbon and phosphate starvation.

regulatoryInteractions.note: The AppY protein is also involved in anaerobic induction of the hya operon, which encodes hydrogenase 1 and is located immediately upstream from the appCBA operon. The AppY protein regulates AppA synthesis by activating transcription from the appCp promoter. Furthermore, the appY gene might be autoregulated. Genetic analysis of the appCp promoter region indicates that the presence of sequences upstream from the -10 region are required for activation of the appCp promoter by AppY protein and anaerobiosis, suggesting that this region has an AppY-binding site.

promoter.note: In the argO and dapB promoters, the lysine repression of ArgP-dependent transcription between argO and dapB is apparently different. In the dapBp1 promoter, lysine prevents binding of ArgP |CITS:[RDBECOLIPRC10059]|, whereas in the argO promoter, lysine traps RNA polymerase recruitment by ArgP |CITS:[17504942 ]|.

regulatoryInteractions.note: The transcription of argO is induced by ArgP when it is bound to arginine, but it is inhibited when lysine is bound to ArgP |CITS: [RDBECOLIPRC09060]|. ArgP regulates the argO operon by a mechanism involving active trapping at the argOp promoter by ArgP of RNA polymerase, which is then prevented from being released and engaging in productive transcription |CITS:[RDBECOLIPRC09060][RDBECOLIPRC13415]|.
